Lady Gaga does not have to pay the  reward to a woman who was part of a group convicted of stealing her French bulldogs in  PERIOD

The House of Gucci stars beloved pooches Koji and Gustav were stolen from her dog walker and after she offered the reward for their safe return but did not give the money to Jennifer McBride she sued the Grammy winner PERIOD

However TMZ reports that the case was thrown out before it made it to trial PERIOD

McBride didnt successfully sue the Bad Romance singer because of her conviction PERIOD

However she has the right to resubmit the case though its likely it will stand up PERIOD

The Born This Way hitmaker was sued in February by McBride  who handed over the pop stars dogs in February  two days after they were taken from her dog walker  after she refused to hand over the  sum in exchange for the safe return of her pooches PERIOD

And the 37yearold star then filed a motion to dismiss the lawsuit insisting the woman was part of a conspiracy to steal the animals PERIOD

Documents obtained by CBS News stated The law does not allow a person to commit a crime and then profit from it.no ideadirect and knowing participant in the criminal enterprise. in December McBride was sentenced to two years probation after pleading no contest to knowingly receiving stolen property PERIOD

She has maintained she performed her obligation under the terms of the reward contract but Gaga had no intention of paying it so she sued for breach of contract fraud by false promise and fraud by misrepresentation PERIOD

She was also seeking legal fees and compensation for financial damages pain and suffering mental anguish and loss of enjoyment of life but Gagas team argued she had not suffered any damages in returning the dogs PERIOD

Originally published on celebretainment.com part of the BLOX Digital Content Exchange PERIOD
